Hello!

I'm developing my own mod and i want to use  assets- textures and plugins (modify and release them in my mod) from two other mods (which are not mine). One is released under CC BY-SA license and the other one is released under MiT license. Is it allowed to use both MiT and CC BY-SA license in one mod? If so then should i release my mod under both MiT and CC BY-SA license?

Sorry if i opened this topic in the wrong section.

Edited May 31, 2018 by L0ck0n

CC BY-SA forces you to release under that Licence, but only the stuff originally licensed like that. You can release different parts of your mod under different licences too. Nertea does this, so look at his threads to see what I mean.
If you want to, you can state the original license and copyright for the MIT stuff and release it all under CC-BY-SA. I think this would probably be less complicated...

4 hours ago, Mrcarrot said:

Less complicated than saying "Textures are CC BY-SA and code is MIT"(or vice versa)?
